item.title: Excessive littering, 5th January
item.description:

item.title: Doubled yellow lines and stop lines need repainting, 5th January
item.description:
I have reported this issue a number of times and over Christmas we nearly had an accident with a car coming up Leckwith Ave and not seeing the stop line and triangle and going straight across Glenview without stopping and just missing a car travelling down Glenview. The double yellow lines also need renewing as people are parking on the corner of the road also blocking the view down Glenview.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckwith Avenue, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broke down car dumped in car park, 5th January
item.description:
Vehicle has got major front damage and was seen on CCTV at 5:35am on 24/12/2024 being pushed into car park spot, it has been left unattended for almost 2 weeks now. Potentially stolen as very suspect damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lower Road, Lower Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Overflowing litter bin, 5th January
item.description:
This litter bin has once again failed to be emptied by the Council and is overflowing onto the pavement. It has again been used to dispose of domestic waste as well as general litter and dog waste bags. This bin is becoming a nuisance as we have a large number of foxes roaming the area foraging for food. Please can the bin be removed as the Council are failing in their duty to regularly empty it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kelby Path, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Salt box - urgent, 5th January
item.description:
The sale box opposite 71 Lynwood grove, BR6 0BQ needs refilling and the dangerous icy conditions currently is making it impossible for residents of the road to use the salt from this box to spread on road and dropped kerb to drive vehicles and walk. Please refill this salt box with salt as high urgency matter. Some slat that is in there is solid and not able to be used. Many thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynwood Grove, Crofton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
